intro: Canthium calcicola, commonly known as the limestone canthium, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils, often found in rocky or limestone-rich environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
